summary: This is a daily key count log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated June 28, 2019. It records the inventory of keys across various security rings (A, B, C, D, E, G, L, Q, S, V, P) and other areas, noting totals and any discrepancies. The document is marked 'Sensitive But Unclassified' and appears to be routine prison administrative paperwork.

persons.name: Finley
persons.context: Name appears in the legend/header section of the first page of the key count log.

events.title: Daily Key Count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine administrative inventory of all keys at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, categorized by security ring and location.

keyFacts: Document is a daily key count log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated Friday, June 28, 2019.
The log inventories keys across multiple security rings (A, B, C, D, E, G, L, Q, S, V, P) and other areas like Control, Lobby, Lockshop, and Sec. Safe.
The final synopsis states a total of 1,422 keys were counted for the whole institution, with 122 being 24-hour keys.
The document is marked 'Sensitive But Unclassified' and was reviewed and approved by operations lieutenant and captain.

This appears to be standard prison administrative record-keeping, not directly related to any specific incident or person in the Epstein case, though it originates from the facility where he was held.
